change.changenote: Section 1.1 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 228/2009, effective September 28, 2009.

definition.def: means, for a provision listed in Appendix D below the name of a jurisdiction, the provision set opposite that provision below the name of another jurisdiction;

paragraph.paragraphtext: National Instrument 41-101 General Prospectus Requirements,
National Instrument 44-101 Short Form Prospectus Distributions,
National Instrument 44-102 Shelf Distributions,
National Instrument 44-103 Post-Receipt Pricing, or
National Instrument 81-101 Mutual Fund Prospectus Disclosure;

definition.def: includes an amendment to a preliminary prospectus;
means, for a person or company, the jurisdiction of the principal regulator;
means, for a person or company, the securities regulatory authority or regulator determined in accordance with Part 3 or 4, as applicable;
includes an amendment to a prospectus;
has the same meaning as in National Instrument 13-101 System for Electronic Document Analysis and Retrieval.

change.changenote: Section 1.1 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 238/2014, effective January 11, 2015.

bcl:definition.bcl:text: NI 31-103 means National Instrument 31-103 Registration Requirements and Exemptions;

change.changenote: Section 1.1 definition of "principal regulator" BEFORE amended by BC Reg 158/2016, effective June 23, 2016.

bcl:definition.bcl:text: principal regulator means, for a person or company, the securities regulatory authority or regulator determined in accordance with Part 3, 4 or 4A, as applicable;

change.changenote: Section 1.1 definition of "SEDAR" BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 139/2023, effective June 9, 2023.

bcl:definition.bcl:text: SEDAR has the same meaning as in National Instrument 13-101 System for Electronic Document Analysis and Retrieval;

change.changenote: Section 1.1 definition of "SEDAR+" was added by BC Reg 139/2023, effective June 9, 2023.
Part 2 BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 228/2009, effective September 28, 2009.

section.marginalnote: Exemption from non-harmonized continuous disclosure requirements
section.sectiontext: A provision listed in Appendix A does not apply to a reporting issuer if the reporting issuer is also a reporting issuer under the securities legislation of another jurisdiction of Canada.

change.changenote: Section 3.3 (1) (b) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 139/2023, effective June 9, 2023.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: at the time of filing the preliminary prospectus, the filer indicates on SEDAR that it is filing the preliminary prospectus under this Instrument,

change.changenote: Section 3.3 (2) (b) (ii) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 139/2023, effective June 9, 2023.

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: indicated on SEDAR that it filed the related pro forma prospectus under this Instrument at the time of filing the related pro forma prospectus,

change.changenote: Section 3.4 BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 228/2009, effective September 28, 2009.

subsection.subsectiontext: A provision listed in Appendix C does not apply to a preliminary prospectus if

paragraph.paragraphtext: the preliminary prospectus is filed under a provision set out in Appendix B and under a national prospectus instrument,
the preliminary prospectus is filed in at least one other jurisdiction of Canada, and
a jurisdiction where the preliminary prospectus is filed is the principal jurisdiction for the filing of the preliminary prospectus.

subsection.subsectiontext: A provision listed in Appendix C does not apply to a prospectus, other than a preliminary prospectus, if

paragraph.paragraphtext: the prospectus is filed under a provision set out in Appendix B and under a national prospectus instrument,
the prospectus is filed in at least one other jurisdiction of Canada, and
a jurisdiction where the prospectus is filed is the principal jurisdiction for the filing of the prospectus.

change.changenote: Section 4.4 BEFORE amended by BC Reg 228/2009, effective September 28, 2009.

section.marginalnote: Principal regulator â€” head office not in a specified jurisdiction
section.sectiontext: Subject to sections 4.5 and 4.6, if the jurisdiction identified under section 4.2 or 4.3, as applicable, is not a specified jurisdiction, the principal regulator for the application is the securities regulatory authority or regulator of the specified jurisdiction with which,

paragraph.paragraphtext: in the case of an application for an exemption from a provision related to insider reporting listed in Appendix D, the reporting issuer has the most significant connection,

in the case of an application for an exemption related to a provision related to take-over bids listed in Appendix D, the issuer whose securities are subject to the take-over bid has the most significant connection, or
in any other case, the person or company, or in the case of an investment fund, the investment fund manager, has the most significant connection.

change.changenote: Section 4.4.1 was enacted by BC Reg 228/2009, effective September 28, 2009.
Section 4.5 (1) and (2) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 228/2009, effective September 28, 2009.

subsection.subsectiontext: Subject to subsection (2), if a person or company is not seeking an exemption in the jurisdiction of the principal regulator, as determined under section 4.2, 4.3 or 4.4, as applicable, the principal regulator for the application is the securities regulatory authority or regulator in the specified jurisdiction

paragraph.paragraphtext: in which the person or company is seeking the exemption, and
with which

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: in the case of an application for an exemption from a provision related to insider reporting, the reporting issuer has the most significant connection,
in the case of an application for an exemption from a provision related to take-over bids, the issuer whose securities are subject to the take-over bid has the most significant connection, or
in any other case, the person or company, or in the case of an investment fund, the investment fund manager, has the most significant connection.

subsection.subsectiontext: If at any one time a person or company is seeking more than one exemption and not all of the exemptions are needed in the jurisdiction of the principal regulator, as determined under section 4.2, 4.3 or 4.4 or subsection (1), as applicable, the person or company may make the application to the securities regulatory authority or regulator in the specified jurisdiction

paragraph.paragraphtext: in which the person or company is seeking all of the exemptions, and
with which,

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: in the case of an application for an exemption from a provision related to insider reporting, the reporting issuer has the most significant connection,
in the case of an application for exemption from a provision related to take-over bids, the issuer whose securities are subject to the take-over bid has the most significant connection, or
in any other case, the person or company, or in the case of an investment fund, the investment fund manager, has the most significant connection.

change.changenote: Section 4.7 (1) BEFORE amended by BC Reg 228/2009, effective September 28, 2009.

subsection.subsectiontext: If an application is made in the principal jurisdiction for an exemption from a provision of securities legislation listed in Appendix D, the equivalent provision of the local jurisdiction does not apply if

paragraph.paragraphtext: the local jurisdiction is not the principal jurisdiction for the application,
the principal regulator for the application granted the exemption,

the person or company that made the application gives notice to the securities regulatory authority or regulator that this subsection is intended to be relied upon for the equivalent provision of the local jurisdiction, and
the person or company relying on the exemption complies with any terms, conditions, restrictions or requirements imposed by the principal regulator as if they were imposed in the local jurisdiction.

change.changenote: Part 4A was enacted by BC Reg 228/2009, effective September 28, 2009.
Part 4B was enacted by BC Reg 78/2012, effective April 20, 2012.
Part 4C was enacted by BC Reg 158/2016, effective June 23, 2016.
Appendix A BEFORE repealed by BC Reg 228/2009, effective September 28, 2009.
